<!-- {{! Do not edit this file directly. This is generated by the `generate-settings-readme` npm script }} -->

The following are the default values of the settings provided by the Ansible
Language Server:

- **ansible.ansible.path**: Path to the ansible executable<br />_default value:
  `ansible`_

- **ansible.ansible.useFullyQualifiedCollectionNames**: Toggle usage of fully
  qualified collection names (FQCN) when inserting module names<br />_default
  value: `true`_

- **ansible.ansibleLint.enabled**: Toggle usage of ansible-lint<br />_default
  value: `true`_

- **ansible.ansibleLint.path**: Path to the ansible-lint
  executable<br />_default value: `ansible-lint`_

- **ansible.ansibleLint.arguments**: Optional command line arguments to be
  appended to ansible-lint invocation<br />_default value: ``_

- **ansible.python.interpreterPath**: Path to the python/python3 executable.
  This settings may be used to make the extension work with ansible and
  ansible-lint installations in a python virtual environment<br />_default
  value: ``_

- **ansible.python.activationScript**: Path to a custom activation script, which
  is to be used instead of te settings above to run in a python virtual
  environment<br />_default value: ``_

- **ansible.executionEnvironment.containerEngine**: Container engine to be used
  while running with execution environment. valid values are &#x60;auto&#x60;,
  &#x60;podman&#x60; and &#x60;docker&#x60;. For &#x60;auto&#x60;, it will look
  for podman and then for docker<br />_default value: `auto`_

- **ansible.executionEnvironment.enabled**: Toggle usage of an execution
  environment<br />_default value: `false`_

- **ansible.executionEnvironment.image**: Name of the execution environment to
  be used<br />_default value: `quay.io/ansible/creator-ee:latest`_

- **ansible.executionEnvironment.pullPolicy**: Image pull policy to be used.
  Valid values are &#x60;always&#x60;, &#x60;missing&#x60;, &#x60;never&#x60;
  and &#x60;tag&#x60;. always will always pull the image when extension is
  activated or reloaded. &#x60;missing&#x60; will pull if not locally available.
  &#x60;never&#x60; will never pull the image and &#x60;tag&#x60; will always
  pull if the image tag is &#x27;latest&#x27;, otherwise pull if not locally
  available.<br />_default value: `missing`_
